use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_column_text]British Columbia’s Skills Immigration category contains multiple streams designed to provide immigration pathways for qualified individuals of different backgrounds. The BC PNP Skilled Worker is one of the most popular streams in this category. This guide will give an overview of the BC Skilled Worker stream and its eligibility requirements.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row What is the BC PNP Skilled Worker?

The BC PNP Skilled Worker program of BC PNP Skills Immigration stream offers an immigration route for skilled workers in specific occupations. This includes workers in professional, technical, management, trades, and other occupations.

The stream also operates with the Express Entry system. Applicants who are nominated under the Express Entry BC Skilled Worker stream will receive extra points on their application when they apply for permanent residence through one of the Federal immigration programs.

BC PNP Skilled Worker Requirements

These are the common eligibility requirements that apply to all BC PNP Skills Immigration categories, include:

1. General Requirements

[/vc_column_text]
  • Intention to Live in BC
  • Economic Benefit to British Columbia
  • Minimum Language Requirements (CLB 4)
  • Valid Immigration Status in Canada
[vc_column_text]There are some additional requirements if you have a job offer.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”No Line” custom_height=”20″][nectar_btn size=”large” button_style=”regular” button_color_2=”Accent-Color” icon_family=”default_arrow” text=”Skills Immigration General Requirements” url=”https://www.elaarimmigration.ca/bc-pnp-programs/#general-requirements”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” top_padding=”4%” text_align=”left” el_id=”eligible-occupations” css=”.vc_custom_1652268747402{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}”][vc_column_inner column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_custom_heading text=”2. Job Offer” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1651823347900{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}”][vc_column_text]Applicants must possess a signed job offer letter for full-time employment in a National Occupation Code (NOC) TEER 0, 1, 2 or 3 occupation. This job offer must be signed and presented on official company letterhead.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” top_padding=”4%” text_align=”left” css=”.vc_custom_1651832326246{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}”][vc_column_inner column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_custom_heading text=”3. Work Experience” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1651831730032{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}”][vc_column_text]Applicants must possess at least two years of work experience in an occupation that falls under NOC TEER level 0, 1, 2 or 3. They can acquire this work experience through full-time positions, even if they are part of co-op work terms.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” top_padding=”4%” text_align=”left” css=”.vc_custom_1651832347226{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}”][vc_column_inner column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_custom_heading text=”4. Express Entry BC Requirements” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1652268887855{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}”][vc_column_text]Applicants using the Express Entry BC (EEBC) route are required to have an active Express Entry Profile and a current Job Seeker Validation Code. These two items indicate that the applicant is eligible for one of the economic immigration programs offered by the Federal Government.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” scene_position=”center” top_padding=”5%” left_padding_desktop=”8%” right_padding_desktop=”8%” left_padding_phone=”7%” right_padding_phone=”7%” text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” overlay_strength=”0.3″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][nectar_highlighted_text color_type=”regular” highlight_color=”#ffc3b7″ style=”half_text”]

Who should apply for BC PNP Skilled Worker?

[/nectar_highlighted_text][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”bottom” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” top_padding=”3%” text_align=”left”][vc_column_inner column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”30px” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”]
  • According to the requirements stated above, the BC PNP Skilled Worker category is for people with two years of work experience in specific occupations and who also possess a valid job offer.
  • Prospective BC PNP Skilled Worker applicants should ensure they meet these specific requirements as well as the general Skills Immigration category requirements related to qualifications, language proficiency, wages, income, and intent to live in BC before applying for this program.
  • The BC PNP Skilled Worker category aims to attract workers who can become part of British Columbia’s workforce and contribute to its economy.
  • Prospective applicants should ensure that they can present a strong case that they will meet these requirements if they wish to receive a provincial nomination.

Move to British Columbia through  BC PNP Skilled Worker Program

Immigrate to Canada as a foreign skilled worker through the BC PNP Skilled Worker program of BC Skills Immigration stream.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner content_placement=”middle”
